recipes.name: Adobo
recipes.description: A popular Filipino dish consisting of meat (commonly chicken, pork, or a combination) marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and black peppercorns then simmered until tender.
ingredients: 1 kg chicken or pork, cut into serving pieces
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Marinate the meat in this mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the marinated meat until brown.
Pour in the marinade and water. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until the meat is tender and the sauce is reduced and thickened.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Sinigang
recipes.description: A sour soup or stew characterized by its distinct sour flavor, typically made with pork, beef, or seafood, along with vegetables like kangkong (water spinach), radish, eggplant, and tomatoes.
ingredients: 500g pork ribs or pork belly, cut into chunks
1 large daikon radish, peeled and sliced
Fish sauce or salt, to taste
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil. Add the pork ribs and simmer until tender.
Add onions and tomatoes, and simmer until softened.
Add the radish and eggplant, then the sinigang mix. Simmer until vegetables are cooked.
Add kangkong and chili peppers. Season with fish sauce or salt to taste.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Kare-Kare
recipes.description: A rich and savory Filipino stew made with oxtail, tripe, and vegetables cooked in a thick peanut sauce, served with bagoong (shrimp paste) on the side.
ingredients: 1 kg oxtail or beef tripe, cut into pieces
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch lengths
Fish sauce or salt, to taste
instructions: Boil the oxtail or tripe until tender. Set aside the broth.
In a separate pan, sauté garlic and onions until fragrant. Add the peanut butter and ground toasted rice, then stir in the oxtail or tripe and annatto water (water from soaking annatto seeds).
Pour in the reserved broth and simmer until the meat is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
Add the vegetables and cook until tender.
Season with fish sauce or salt to taste.
Serve hot with bagoong on the side.

recipes.name: Lechon
recipes.description: A whole roasted pig dish, popular during celebrations and special occasions, known for its crispy skin and tender meat seasoned with spices and herbs.
instructions: Clean the pig thoroughly and pat it dry.
Rub salt, pepper, minced garlic, and chopped lemongrass all over the pig, including inside the cavity.
Roast the pig on a spit over charcoal or in a large oven until the skin is crispy and golden brown, and the meat is tender.
Serve hot with a dipping sauce made from vinegar, soy sauce, and chili peppers.

recipes.name: Pancit
recipes.description: A stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, meat (such as chicken, pork, or shrimp), and vegetables, seasoned with soy sauce and often garnished with calamansi and chopped green onions.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, cabbage, snow peas)
Calamansi or lemon wedges, for serving
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in water until soft, then drain.
In a wok or large skillet, heat oil and sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add chicken and pork, cook until browned.
Add shrimp and mixed vegetables, cook until shrimp turn pink and vegetables are tender.
Add the drained noodles and soy sauce, toss to combine.
Season with fish sauce to taste.
Serve hot with calamansi wedges and chopped green onions.
